3A7C5E34FBDA42C38AEF028D13063935.description: Investigate the trade qualifier pathway as an alternate pathway to certification in a non-compulsory trade in Saskatchewan.

0BFE03F9D31547E0B4E1407281FE3A9C.description: Differentiate between compulsory (i.e., construction electrician, plumber, refrigeration and air conditioning mechanic, sheet metal worker and sprinkler fitter) and non-compulsory trades in Saskatchewan.

806EF0385D5041C182CBA1C5305FBEC0.description: Explore opportunities and programs that address the issue of underrepresented populations in the trades.

08C307A3547545CE8825705176B74458.description: Discuss requirements and opportunities for apprentices and journeypersons to train and work in other jurisdictions.

D6EE1A2F4D8A4ACFB043EF2BDC8B0A05.description: Research the qualifications needed to obtain Red Seal and Blue Seal certifications.

BB281D55EE564555AC11EC056A642764.description: Use appropriate trade-related terminology including: apprentice; journeyperson; indenture; pre-employment training; designated trade and sub-trade; and, advanced standing.

3B159706C03C4252935492310D1EC78C.description: Investigate the apprenticeship process in a trade of personal interest.

4FE1B5C3E9DC438C82EFE7F374AE834C.description: Investigate available programs and opportunities such as the Saskatchewan Youth Apprenticeship program and secondary apprenticeship credits that support transitions from high school.

99C03133A34D4BDDBD0B2AEF51E2C427.description: Discuss the relationship between the trades and national, provincial and territorial certification bodies including the Saskatchewan Apprenticeship and Trade Certification Commission.

D6BB6A688257491D87E9CD25D5D39E96.description: Describe qualities of a successful apprentice.

183E9DE820574511B2AC92F3D5175141.description: Explore the advantages and disadvantages of apprenticeship for the individual and the trade.

A4623D0E3E1A435896A88E3FDF54CAFB.description: Research the history and the role of apprenticeship in the trades.

B178B5659CDB4A3C9CE196A68C2B5CD8.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

C03DBE1D0D7149B0B5EACCEAE6432524.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

0D669CBA666B4A938AB418107C0BE408.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

FB4580210A8F431F95B2EA093E097E5D.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

A3182C4E15194F33A45A9B38F8D70E67.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

FCC2D1C1EB04490F9A0CEDC0DBB76649.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

D77F221815624BB6A158E7BB08432D92.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

F956986A5F194B10B26512CBBE5A3597.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

07F2668BA0954BDFBB6C5729D44CBB88.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

3A3CE91118BD4395ABF7C8133AD3C54F.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

8CBF3F2FE5EF46F2956A580263FA1CFC.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

F3C4AED54E7E4DA3A77C89218CECE53A.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

987D65CF2EC74D50916FDADC4526599F.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

805B9DB86EAB4A69A5D3CC75782F0F70.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

7A67AE2301DE4069BE6A45BEFB3F3158.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

E7CC87D83D1F43C292F6371F24493585.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

1C026AFA532E4AD29F4F968EDB5139A4.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

75F28A83939946E2AA02F3625E403AFE.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

514ABF43EF324DB59EE0DF41CD2F4E7A.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

F2D28AC6F47C4656800B312F41E838A2.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know - the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate - in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

B576DABB9F0D42CE9967B3F7C3E45FED.description: Practise food safety standards when selecting, handling, preparing, cooking, serving and storing fruit desserts and sauces.

9C5AC3CD813B40AF85D99811107F0961.description: Practise safe and proper use of bakeshop tools and equipment.

4D659C23756A424CA1424A0CDBFFB330.description: Assess fruit desserts and sauces based on developed criteria.

B3F3919D154D481F8DD866A853C41BF6.description: Create a fruit sauce and fruit purée.

9464438C34734D1C8565A4B8C73346C3.description: Differentiate between a fruit sauce (i.e., cooked) and fruit purée or coulis (i.e., uncooked) considering qualities such as texture, taste and colour.

F67E1265089046479E1DA370F05150FD.description: Prepare a variety of fruit desserts (e.g., crisps, cobblers, poached fruits, clafoutis and compotes).

903476E0DF20490996E339DEEB9F6160.description: Determine the appropriate selection, preparation and cooking method for a variety of fruits.

82DB727537DA4FFBB3863274CF564078.description: Discuss the effects of different cooking methods on the colour, texture, appearance and nutrient retention of fruits.

8669AA840D95406B8E069BBFF19FD8D4.description: Examine fruit dessert and sauce recipes from a variety of cultures, including Métis and First Nations.

2A265E5D60624B7D9F5CAE97F09D818A.description: Research how fruit (e.g., fresh, frozen and canned) is used in desserts and sauces.

6E300D4AC91C4DCCAADBA5C5AE4FBC29.description: Create a variety of fruit desserts and sauces.

79A042BAC9F2477EAB20BF5B2014A299.description: Practise food safety standards when handling, preparing, cooking, serving and storing pies and tarts.

3FA25B6366F343D6B693C68C18F0B612.description: Practise safe and proper use of bakeshop tools and equipment.

E895AE1EBED6463898C17C4747DA9460.description: Create a variety of pies for a school or community bake sale considering the cost of ingredients and dietary preferences.

4DCD286C423D489F816AA81C401864EF.description: Prepare a variety of fillings such as: fruit fillings (e.g., cooked juice method, cooked fruit method and old-fashioned method); sweet or savoury custard-type (e.g., pumpkin, pecan, sweet potato pie and tourtière); cream fillings (e.g., coconut, banana and chocolate); and, chiffon fillings (e.g., strawberry and orange).

A44ECAF54A1C412BB89671074DB44A61.description: Form and bake pie shells for unbaked pies.

CFEAC80AA09F488EB3107FC2DC67765E.description: Analyze problems with pies including toughness, crumbling, sogginess, shrinkage, curdling and determine their causes.

E3E1B95BF28645728815C4EDA6DB5D8E.description: Follow the procedure for rolling pie dough and lining pans including selecting the best dough to use, scaling, dusting, rolling, placing and crimping.

53F2ED59A5F74D188CE6CBC7325C444D.description: Create short doughs and graham cracker crusts for pies or tarts.

562B5534D7C148ADB857354BC2117F01.description: Identify the four main ingredients needed to create pie dough including flour, fat, liquid and salt and the importance of each one.

7D311B1C3B3943E1A1C40E38BC49478D.description: Differentiate between mealy and flaky pie dough.

CE6E23EB36E944A582F53E27644AEFC8.description: Create pies and tarts using a variety of doughs and fillings.

C67AACF98A2C4B0183E91F25FF31DA9C.description: Practise food safety standards when handling, preparing, cooking, serving and storing meringue-based desserts.

03FBF2CB63324AD3B4217B07FF6ACFA4.description: Practise safe and proper use of bakeshop tools and equipment.

D9321AB2ACB147BEAAC1B1A6B887ECB4.description: Create cookies made from meringue (e.g., pavlova and macaroons) and cakes made from meringue (e.g., angel food and chiffon).

7D2DB00B0CE24C519EF89512D12B2C39.description: Analyze the results of peak stages.

C0D762A806AA4575838B6022A0628D05.description: Practise foaming egg whites to the three distinct stages including soft, medium and stiff peak.

EBA69B6731E846AC9CC37A6BBD9C0206.description: Examine quality indicators (e.g., fat inhibits foam, sugar stabilizes foam, a mild acid will foam to a greater volume, egg whites foam better at room temperature and overbeaten egg whites will curdle) in meringue production.

8D4BAD7AB19C435283A42CD6F5009CFE.description: Identify ingredients and techniques to create meringue.

DE0F031A1E10405EB3DC479DD3FD001E.description: Discuss how meringue is used to create a variety of desserts.

FDA6823FDB1844F282798550E67EE196.description: Create meringue for use in a variety of desserts.

5DE9541AEF2844A08E1918A518972003.description: Prepare a variety of pastry creams (e.g., napoleons, éclairs and cream puffs).

EA2681383A504293A0A96ADBA5750B48.description: Prepare crème anglaise (e.g., dessert sauce and Bavarian cream).

012A23B34F93469AA25D87C7E909A8DC.description: Explain how pastry cream and crème anglaise can be used in the bakeshop (e.g., pastry creams for cream pies and crème anglaise as a sauce and base for desserts).

5A7027B52CDD49099292EAC40937B90C.description: Decorate cakes or cupcakes with piped icing using a pastry bag and a variety of pastry tips.

68FEF1A4E4EC4FEEB0E3A7D6FC7D87F5.description: Compare a convenience fondant to a homemade fondant, considering cost, taste, time and quality.

6886218A8C8147A9B1A42C620F117D8D.description: Differentiate between fondant, foam and fudge icings.

3E91210434E6416CBB80C8824C942629.description: Create fondant, foam and fudge icings to decorate layered cakes.

12D97F93AFBC407FA13A62C5A19891EC.description: Practise food safety standards when preparing, baking, serving and storing cakes and cupcakes.

7B5A02237A694B01B7BB344DF1037C7C.description: Practise safe and proper use of bakeshop tools and equipment.

137E581760ED499687E589C2A881FB08.description: Troubleshoot common cake faults involving volume, crust, texture and flavour.

B6931C6B797040D0A5D23EBB496816E4.description: Apply the appropriate mixing methods used to create low-fat and foam-type cakes such as sponge, angel food and chiffon.

6780F4CAB25846EA8EE5F4B5EF8E608D.description: Discuss the necessity of separating eggs for foam type cakes.

1E9D2A2927294194944BF929FBED2991.description: Explain the correct procedures for scaling, panning, baking, checking for doneness and cooling cakes and cupcakes.

E0AB3C9FC16D40EB8FD3B53D09E2ABED.description: Review and practise the three main goals of cake batter mixing, including: creating uniform batter; forming and incorporating air cells in the batter; and, developing the proper texture in the finished product.

7F9B38AF9CF64D98A22BA222D2308A68.description: Create low-fat and foam-type cakes and cupcakes.

37D4E72A3E754552819EE4C1B965BD9C.description: Produce traditional yeast breads and unleavened breads from various cultures.

B89025B50B5741BFA7EC79B529C25546.description: Prepare a recipe or recipes of interest, considering cultural protocols and practices associated with the preparation, presentation and serving of the cuisine.

26EB302C15834AB6844C7FE7CD64F1B8.description: Select a recipe or recipes of interest, considering the availability of ingredients, cost of ingredients, time commitment, required tools, equipment and cooking methods.

28F451D92C334C7B99142DFD79B1160B.description: Identify equipment and cooking methods appropriate for a selected food.

C59CBD51EFCA44F0BD912B08ED268363.description: Examine the impact of substituting ingredients (e.g., Greek yoghurt for sour cream and lemon juice or vinegar plus milk for buttermilk) in a traditional or contemporary recipe.

E29FD48075FA44C3A5907AC2FD814BEA.description: Identify ingredient substitutions that can be made to recipes due to challenges of sourcing ingredients.

B10CBC27EA8048BE981305950C899909.description: Investigate the availability of food staples from selected cultures and plan a menu using those foods.

9652264B976D4051833402696FEB1D20.description: Identify food staples, including herbs and spices, from a variety of cuisines.

1944BCA6BC834699962CC9ED1B0360DE.description: Create a written, visual, digital or audio inventory of available cuisine from various cultures, including Métis and First Nations, in Saskatchewan.

FDDEC103B46543B5BC77A172DD9C10F3.description: Explore Saskatchewan resources (e.g., family recipes, community cookbooks, and menus from feasts, celebrations and local restaurants) for examples of traditional and contemporary cuisine from various cultures, including Métis and First Nations.

21F407B7E565469280F24C803731DCA8.description: Define cuisine (e.g., the ingredients, seasonings and cooking techniques associated with a culture, population, region or country), including types of cuisine (e.g., haute, classic, nouvelle, regional and fusion).

3D2396A272164CC88C6A6A5E4104C644.description: Explore traditional and contemporary cuisine from various cultures, including Métis and First Nations, in Saskatchewan.

C15C7B2B147A4FA283E4EB8DF13F8140.description: Discuss substitutes for flour-based pasta, including gluten-free pasta (e.g., brown rice pasta).

0133BBF64C5E4809BB5035BA8C3459C5.description: Compare commercially made pasta to fresh-made pasta, considering taste, texture, cost and labour.

D8B00ACB22E8470297B3D194F81D7FAD.description: Combine fresh pasta with sauces such as spaghetti with tomato sauce and fettucine with Alfredo sauce.

4CF01C865D5A4CF482A03AB0F345D9D9.description: Practise cutting pasta using a knife or machine.

E387762CF9BD450B8408AD943CAC2D5D.description: Prepare egg pasta (e.g., spaghetti, fettuccini and ravioli).

C6991D36465B4E6EA4FE2EB440F884E8.description: Demonstrate cooking pasta and noodles to al dente.

D949E11A147B440CADBC8B58C3159893.description: Discuss the cooking term al dente.

6BBDABABC3F2499583F0B70092FCE82E.description: Identify types of pasta (e.g., spaghetti, fettuccini, couscous and rotini) and their uses.

30EB0EFF713F4D51B2356CB26DECF4CC.description: Prepare various types of pasta and noodles.

1A12CB86C70149DFAC42C2B9DBA2CDDB.description: Select and prepare a rice dish, considering budget, time, accessible ingredients and dietary preferences (e.g., cultural, medical and personal).

26785B85AEF34DE1B03554C1ACD36D64.description: Consult resources such as cookbooks, recipes and menus for rice-based dishes such as sushi, jambalaya, paella, jollof, fried rice and risotto.

5371874D4A0F47D38D5620B6E774080B.description: Apply the appropriate cooking method for cooking rice, including: simmering method for cooking varieties of long grain white rice and parboiled long grain white rice; pilaf method for cooking rice; and, pasta method for cooking large quantities of rice.

2ECA6351FDEB4EEEB6245DCEDB49CDD0.description: Research the varieties of rice, including long grain white, parboiled, basmati, jasmine and instant, and their use in various dishes.

1022C5E121024C878F674DAA59CCED30.description: Determine how to purchase and safely store potatoes.

F6BE47A29C224BC780CB585075EEDAB3.description: Explore varieties of mealy (e.g., russet, white and purple) and waxy (e.g., red, yellow and fingerling) potatoes.

14CA49EF249F4AA78B5E5CC5FD27A0B2.description: Create a variety of classic and modern potato dishes.

5C2F371ABC874CC1A0F1F9C53F6D45AD.description: Demonstrate the method of soaking dried beans and peas for cooking.

E224E0CD7BB140BAB355900501953DC5.description: Examine the use of plant-based proteins in menu items.

7438C291E9D74086AABD2528B52C0466.description: Explore different techniques for incorporating a roux.

ACA7975067E14138BBE1436ED9F40FDB.description: Research derivative sauces that can be made from each of the mother sauces.

E888F92D84BC4B2A83E4F0AD4B13258C.description: Prepare the five mother sauces (i.e., béchamel, velouté, espagnole, tomato and hollandaise).

FDE96974E0174504936CAECDB2306961.description: Differentiate among the five mother sauces (i.e., béchamel, velouté, espagnole, tomato and hollandaise).

CB655E60194B499DA9BE69268CE965CC.description: Create the five mother sauces and appropriate derivative sauces.

AADF234A5E544B8CBA28AA74C142D024.description: Practise food safety standards when preparing, cooking, serving and storing soups.

834A9C965E8F41BCA4DE41EE90914490.description: Assess the soup, using the developed criteria, and document progress.

589FE0AE66124D8BB0106CE21CAB8FAD.description: Develop criteria to assess the soup and the thickening technique.

F3424812858A4D8280CF55DB4AF869D8.description: Create a soup using a specific thickening technique.

19D0FF2A15E248F7BFDB274D6EDBDB3D.description: Examine the use of thickening agents in the preparation of soups (e.g., lentil, vegetable, coconut curry and lemon rice).

672133A43AD34B0FB2F3A9EB8A1040CA.description: Demonstrate how to make a variety of thickening agents.

F828567282F74413B43B50A9BE60194F.description: Describe the purpose and types of thickening agents (e.g., slurry, beurre manié, white roux, whitewash and starchy vegetables).

2AB17C461B3E4C91B1B110663A1357C4.description: Investigate a variety of thickening techniques to prepare soups.

1607EF8BE4EA425E886A2A1603538640.description: Practise food safety standards when preparing, serving and storing hors d’oeuvres and appetizers.

26CD8B68D73C4BE6820C726390DF5C73.description: Practise appropriate personal hygiene and the use of personal protective equipment (PPE).

DF5D7006D2354BFC9F01C75301F46724.description: Investigate various methods of serving hors d’oeuvres.

FCF07297FB4F44998A04DFAEE56A94CE.description: Plan, prepare and present canapés, relishes and dips (e.g., guacamole, salsa, hummus and tzatziki).

367BF4374920428CBD73DA36A973FC68.description: Collaborate with peers to determine characteristics (e.g., taste, visual appeal and aroma) of high quality hors d’oeuvres.

80E4A3E160944F919C640C7679271DCA.description: Research purpose and variety of hors d’oeuvres.

2DFD5D0A30D04009960E4DE7FFE582E5.description: Investigate the difference between hors d’oeuvres, canapés and appetizers.

7DB3B7A966EC45B2ADA2AAB69CF0C7FB.description: Prepare and present a variety of hors d’oeuvres and appetizers.

F1126B6BDEBE4107AED48A525504DA16.description: Practise food safety standards when handling, preparing, cooking, serving and storing fruits and vegetables.

395F29968E534AA890BF3BCB296CA1E1.description: Select and prepare wild fruits or vegetables (e.g., chokecherries, Saskatoon berries, edible flowers and chanterelle mushrooms) using traditional First Nations and Métis cooking methods.

3ED9B95B0AF2493FA3BD198A92D05A02.description: Prepare fermented foods (e.g., cucumbers, beets, asparagus, cabbage and carrots).

F749650BA4EC4C059A730A141A39F9B2.description: Assess how cooking times and methods affect the nutritional values, texture, flavour and colour of fruits and vegetable.

125E402CA8C844DEBE1E418BEF21BC5B.description: Select and prepare vegetables and fruits for menu items based on season and availability.

C2C0007A062649E4B8DC341269259DC7.description: Compare large and small batch cooking methods for fruits and vegetables, considering factors such as using various methods for a large quantity (e.g., blanching and then deep-frying) and the loss of quality.

19D6BD65A17843F4A4C340F6FBEC8757.description: Investigate the effects of a variety of moist heat cooking methods (e.g., poaching, boiling, blanching, steaming) on texture, colour and flavour to ensure maximum nutrition of fruits and vegetables.

B0891CBBEAFD449196EE52C47DA522CD.description: Investigate the effects of a variety of dry heat cooking methods (e.g., roasting, sautéing, caramelizing, grilling) on the texture, colour and flavour of fruits and vegetables.

B8FE9539DA074749899DAAE56442EF15.description: Explore the effects of cooking methods on the texture, flavour, colour and nutritional value of fruits and vegetables.

A1954F7E38F64060B0361C35EE77A5BF.description: Practise food safety standards when handling, preparing, serving and storing garnishes and decorations.

0B1DC5401D9D49E79BE01430FFC99B73.description: Explore how current food trends and social media influence food presentation.

ACDA6D29910A439A93AE88822F9E0F38.description: Practise effective plate presentation such as selection of plate size and shape and cleaning the rim of the plate to enhance plate presentation.

8F2439C597344AA19BBA3EEF36789E1C.description: Create garnishes for hot and cold menu items using the fundamentals of plating (e.g., balance, focal point and composition).

224EC59DCBE64F8887B55A88EA949546.description: Determine appropriate garnishes for plated dishes based on colour, shape, texture and flavour.

054F95DFF7364919AE1089A1059707C7.description: Critique images of plated foods and identify key elements (e.g., colour, shape, texture and flavour).

0FE8BBA842A14C6DA45D28D21A2ABE95.description: Describe the function and characteristic of garnishes.

2554B89EBAF4496C9FC9868CFD45DC17.description: Identify techniques (e.g., use of specific foods and plating) for effective food presentation.

23041B84ADBA4F6BA62966145B1F7AA3.description: Examine the impact of garnishes, decorations and food presentation on hot and cold menu items.

7B1DA88E90204943A90402505F998812.description: Food Presentation, Garnish and Decoration A (Optional)

7FCACBD54B77439FB1FCFA3036330743.description: Maintain, clean and properly store knives, cutting tools and equipment.

7C9355F34A454BE2841C3DCEDA3E4703.description: Select appropriate cutting tools and equipment (e.g., robot coupe, food processor, buffalo chopper, fry cutter and mandoline) for identified tasks.

9EC1A8CDF12C47CE9BB3E3AE42650952.description: Discuss purposes for using alternative kitchen tools and equipment (e.g., robot coupe, food processor, buffalo chopper, fry cutter and mandoline) to cut food.

7C34EDA2E68A48E4BBDAAF4BB6A69B23.description: Select the appropriate knife for a particular task.

9BACD93726734FD9A7D24D5A94BCCB9D.description: Research a variety of advanced knife cuts such as brunoise, chiffonade, parisienne, rondelle and batonnet.

D7463E70AF3442B3BC9AF89BF0C6BC85.description: Demonstrate effective use of specialized knives (e.g., boning knife, scimitar, channel and tourne).

B64B446F48804C34ABFD99D1622A7AE4.description: Categorize knives according to purpose, including appropriate procedures for use.

3FF74B6ABE764133A88A5C1D37489483.description: Research specialty knives such as boning knife, scimitar, channel, ulu, tourne and crooked knife.

0D2D9E807C164F2699EFC87AE5B47C50.description: Demonstrate safe and appropriate use of knives.

D69A3E3FAC574C198BB8E6A77F29A702.description: Demonstrate advanced knife skills and cutting techniques.

C82AE989E5584464A5B4B9B7E9F519D5.description: Apply kitchen safety and sanitation practices when cooking food.

D62D382A5C034F3F8D83EFAD226625B8.description: Determine the advantages and challenges of using a variety of cooking methods.

4C4DE59D8672488F83082748F29B9DB2.description: Analyze the impact (e.g., texture, tenderness and taste) of cooking methods on foods.

F9D6C452CD0041B7A84A0ABA9A154E67.description: Demonstrate combination cooking methods such as braising, stewing and sous vide.

F1DF44AAFFA94098BA1AFCB854CCB2C7.description: Demonstrate moist heat cooking methods such as simmering, steaming and poaching.

9C4EEF5EAF20443C9780049F028122F2.description: Use dry heat cooking methods that involve fat (e.g., sautéing, pan frying and deep frying).

70495811EC9542BEA5E79D83966F4E9F.description: Demonstrate dry heat cooking methods that do not involve fat (e.g., roasting, broiling and grilling).

2B072A0ED3CC4CD4941D3AE07D3DA5A3.description: Discuss the six enemies of fat (i.e., water, soap, salt, breadcrumbs, air and heat).

6B4DB3CB75FA411E8F588D3A8BCE90FB.description: Recognize the smoke point and rancidity of various oils and determine the appropriate oil to use for sautéing and deep frying.

0610A3CBC43A455D8AD0E04D80A8CD13.description: Determine the appropriate cooking method to achieve a desired result with a specific ingredient.

3B4EE3688B5A4A58B90AFD1B0955966A.description: Explain the effects of heat (e.g., change in shape, colour and flavour) on foods such as carbohydrates, fibre, water, proteins and fats.

E2CFA1099FA54AAA82D62847CEC8D600.description: Analyze the effects of cooking methods on food.

20DEE3AF7F1743F0A5A1C073E69512DB.description: Develop criteria to assess the menu.

1CC13953E7564A04A295DBBB53527CC5.description: Create a menu, applying menu planning principles such as: balance; flavours, textures, shapes and sizes of food; variety; aesthetics; nutritional quality; costs and production; and, customer satisfaction.

BB33DB14A88C48D896C6928C85B401A0.description: Analyze menus (e.g., static, cycle, market and hybrid) for a variety of budgets, consumer preferences and types of services (e.g., à la carte, semi à la carte and table d’hôte/prix fixe).

9A612B02CE894EA9BFCEF53B55019EAE.description: Examine factors (e.g., sustainability, availability of ingredients, consumer demand, trends and dietary preferences) that influence menu choices.

6E62EC0BE76A4479B1ACB0F987A78F78.description: Investigate factors that influence the type of menu an establishment requires, including: clientele (e.g., hotel, institution, school, catering operation, fast-food and full-service restaurant); customer preference; meals that will be served (e.g., breakfast only, all three meals, and dinner); types of cuisine type of menu; and, courses served.

A6866A39909540D4864BEEA49807DA80.description: Examine the relationship between menu type and resource allocation (e.g., facility and equipment, staff and ingredients).

1689909A537B4B3CBAF6F43075A0D2B1.description: Discuss how items are purchased from a menu (e.g., à la carte, semi à la carte and table d’hôte/prix fixe).

F1B672A073B2498C984E350482DC68D0.description: Investigate the cost of ingredients required for various recipes and menus.

F6433199E9EA4A9080274C3FF357AA21.description: Examine the different types of courses (e.g., hors d’oeuvres, soup, fish, main and dessert) included on a menu.

A8BEB16859CE4D0A879B10EC6C9F593E.description: Differentiate between a classical menu (e.g., seventeen courses) and a modern menu (e.g., three or four courses).

E37DC01FF4B24AE5BEF8C405F85002B2.description: Provide examples of information commonly found on menus such as: origin (e.g., the sources of ingredients, such as the name of the farm or market); grade or quality (e.g., Canada AAA beef); fresh (e.g., not frozen, canned or dried); home-made (e.g., not produced outside the food service establishment); organic; cooking methods (e.g., grilled, roasted and pan-fried); size and portion; price; and, images and photos.

A9C0B5FFE856481D8B71EB2AD1CCC414.description: Describe the types of menus such as static, cycle, market and hybrid.

5684DA042E5E4637A62511506D0AFC4C.description: Explore the principles of menu planning to create a menu.

36CF39188BA246A0B7882FC4C6DF249E.description: Demonstrate appropriate food safety standards when receiving, selecting, handling, preparing, serving and storing food.

94E957EFDCC24141A5AB0C4E945A0027.description: Discuss the role of municipal, provincial and national food safety legislation and regulations.

E87088C9AC77448CB3F520165B912C55.description: Examine safe and sanitary practices to dispose of kitchen waste.

53AF49FDFD084565A4A90B9263BE77C1.description: Explain the importance of kitchen sanitation and personal hygiene in the prevention of food contamination and food-borne illnesses.

45E97F83EE314547BB1575BE6F43BBB9.description: Differentiate date labelling (e.g., best-before, packaged on and expiration) on pre-packaged foods.

5637F27A34954CD8BB08A2C088E402CD.description: Discuss common food safety steps (e.g., clean, separate, cook and chill) to reduce food contamination.

D2FC2125FF774AF7B87937A5E5572B46.description: Differentiate between direct contamination and cross-contamination.

195510C00DD54EE48CB52739EAB384FF.description: Identify causes of food-borne illnesses (e.g., food poisoning and food allergies).

448952961E034C72A2F03DF365EC9AB3.description: List examples of biological (e.g., bacteria and viruses), chemical (e.g., cleaners and disinfectants) and physical (e.g., glass or metal fragments) contaminants.

04E9DDF1B11F4275A398BEB59AA264B9.description: Identify the causes of food contamination (e.g., biological, chemical and physical) that can occur in a commercial kitchen.

1B2C3598DE8A4B7FB50A162FD88E1390.description: Examine appropriate procedures to ensure food safety in the kitchen.

100E71EC2B324B7280796746B6EEE65D.description: Research Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) standards that apply to a commercial kitchen.

3D461D9A98514F15A695B93E1BF89E0E.description: Review the fire evacuation plan for the work area and building.

FF1F32D5344844579F2567289A699065.description: Examine procedures for preventing and dealing with commercial kitchen fires.

94EFF1A0A9A242088BEF0FC528A42685.description: Identify common causes of commercial kitchen fires.

84C49AB13FE145D1B72C6768538B4C71.description: Discuss the importance of reporting workplace incidents or injuries immediately and the proper procedure to do so.

B1419B45E85740A79931BC1F4351F72A.description: Practise safe and hygienic washing of dishes, tools and cookware, either manually or using a dishwasher.

552B9109EE234B1CA01CB2C0E069C2F4.description: Practise safe and hygienic washing of dishes, tools and cookware, either manually or using a dishwasher.

1E853832F87E49CE852679EBBA3D4E58.description: Maintain a clean and sanitary work area, including surfaces (e.g., floors, walls and tables) tools and equipment.

46A6C08155A84BD886A3580075B9D67E.description: Discuss practices to maintain a safe and sanitary kitchen, including prevention of pest infestation.

11F8C10C35BE44EB96673943E77DB197.description: Explain the importance of sanitation in a commercial kitchen.

130D43DE60374A4AAF2078FE92BC8F89.description: Demonstrate personal hygiene (e.g., hand washing and hair restraint) and safe dress (e.g., closed-toe shoes, apron and gloves) when working in a commercial kitchen.

30BCE7CFBCBA470BBFE9497B570D0F89.description: Describe ways to reduce and prevent injury to self and others from unsafe work acts or environments.

23660DC5B0034C61A87C1194CF2ED266.description: Identify industry standard personal protective equipment (PPE) such as safety goggles, gloves, footwear, masks, headwear and protective clothing.

D1C3EF3B121B42D39C318F2B5405F176.description: Discuss the hierarchy of controls as a system for preventing hazards and reducing risk of injury in the workplace, including: elimination - physically removing the hazard; substitution - replacing the hazard; engineering controls - isolating people from the hazard; administrative controls - changing the way people work; and, personal protective equipment - protecting workers with the use of personal protective equipment.

F227F0819BEE44BA94408130FAEF1BD8.description: Research injuries (e.g., strained muscles, cuts and lacerations, slips, falls and pepper burns) common among workers in commercial kitchens.

A180E3F5916C490EAB20DC386B85969D.description: Identify potential worker safety hazards in a commercial kitchen.

621E984D5C574341B19EC52FCE7D9E00.description: Explain the purpose of food safety standards and regulations, including the role of public health inspectors.

753063B528094B318751424B20636F5F.description: Discuss the importance of safety in a commercial kitchen.

B8849799C766428FB492C9D3921F213F.description: Apply kitchen safety and sanitation practices.
